Sentencas: Transport and structural properties of heavily doped ceria can reveal subtle details of the interplay between conductivity and defects aggregation in this material, widely studied as solid electrolyte in solid oxide fuel cells.
Titulo: Transport Properties and High Temperature Raman Features of Heavily Gd-Doped Ceria

Sentencas: The ionic conductivity of heavily Gd-doped ceria samples (Ce1-xGdxO2-x/2 with x ranging between 0.31 and 0.49) was investigated by impedance spectroscopy in the 600-1000 K temperature range.
Titulo: Transport Properties and High Temperature Raman Features of Heavily Gd-Doped Ceria

Sentencas: A slope change was found in the Arrhenius plot at similar to 723 K for samples with x = 0.31 and 0.34, namely close to the compositional boundary of the CeO2-based solid solution.
Titulo: Transport Properties and High Temperature Raman Features of Heavily Gd-Doped Ceria

Sentencas: The described discontinuity, giving rise to two different activation energies, points at the existence of a threshold temperature, below which oxygen vacancies are blocked, and above which they become free to move through the lattice.
Titulo: Transport Properties and High Temperature Raman Features of Heavily Gd-Doped Ceria

Sentencas: This conclusion is well supported by Raman spectroscopy, due to the discontinuity revealed in the Raman shift trend versus temperature of the signal related to defects aggregates which hinder the vacancies movement.
Titulo: Transport Properties and High Temperature Raman Features of Heavily Gd-Doped Ceria

Sentencas: This evidence, observable in samples with x = 0.31 and 0.34 above similar to 750 K, accounts for a weakening of Gd-O bonds within blocking microdomains, which is compatible with the existence of a lower activation energy above the threshold temperature.
Titulo: Transport Properties and High Temperature Raman Features of Heavily Gd-Doped Ceria
